sentences.english: And of course, thank you also for the ocarina, I know I'll be getting lots of use out of it.
sentences.chinese: 當然，非常感謝您帶來的陶笛，我會經常練習它的。

sentences.english: Play a fully functional ocarina, an ancient musical instrument.
sentences.chinese: 吹奏具有完全功能的陶笛，它是一種古老的樂器。

sentences.english: I'm really grateful for your presentation and the ocarina .
sentences.chinese: 非常感謝您的講座和帶來的陶笛。

sentences.english: It was very interesting and got me greatly interested in the ocarina.
sentences.chinese: 陶笛實在是太有趣，我是被深深吸引了。

sentences.english: Wind instruments include the piri (cylindrical oboe), taepyeongso (metal-bell shawm), daegeumsaenghwang (mouth organ) and the hun (ocarina).
sentences.chinese: 管樂器包括圓柱形雙簧管，金屬蘆笛，口琴和陶笛。

sentences.english: The ocarina son sees the other gathering pull to eight bamboo poles far, is one Leng first.
sentences.chinese: 陶笛兒見對方扯到八竿子遠，先是一愣。

sentences.english: Youhui smashes Xiaoxuan's ocarina on purpose in a bid to attract Qingxiang's attention.
sentences.chinese: 友慧爲了引起慶祥的注意而故意打破曉萱的陶笛。

definition: hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
bawu, a free reed wind instrument shaped like a flute and played transversally, associated particularly with minority cultures of Yunnan
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
ukulele/simplified form also written 尤克里里琴
